condition.description:
Fibromyalgia is a disorder that causes muscle pain and fatigue. People with fibromyalgia have "tender points" on the body. Tender points are specific places on the neck, shoulders, back, hips, arms, and legs. These points hurt when pressure is put on them.

People with fibromyalgia may also have other symptoms, such as

  • Trouble sleeping
  • Morning stiffness
  • Headaches
  • Painful menstrual periods
  • Tingling or numbness in hands and feet
  • Problems with thinking and memory (sometimes called "fibro fog")

No one knows what causes fibromyalgia. Anyone can get it, but it is most common in middle-aged women. People with rheumatoid arthritis and other autoimmune diseases are particularly likely to develop fibromyalgia. There is no cure for fibromyalgia, but medicine can help you manage your symptoms. Getting enough sleep, exercising, and eating well may also help.

NIH: National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases

basics.benefits_moa: Cymbalta is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Cymbalta is good for treating depression and anxiety, and may help with chronic pain. More likely than other antidepressants to cause problems if you drink or have high blood pressure.
downsides: Not a good option if you're a heavy drinker, or if you have liver or kidney problems.
Not the best option for people with high blood pressure.
Like most antidepressants, can cause higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.
Full effects in 8 to 12 weeks for mood, 2 weeks for pain.
Stop taking slowly to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Cymbalta is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

description_processed.orig: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Cymbalta with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Cymbalta suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Cymbalta can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Lyrica is a nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Lyrica works well as an add-on medicine for seizures and fibromyalgia, but it's especially effective for nerve-related pain after shingles. Not available as a generic, so it might be expensive.
downsides: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.
Lyrica is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

downsides_processed.orig: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

upsides: Relieves nerve-related (neuropathic) pain caused by different conditions including diabetes, shingles (herpes zoster), fibromyalgia, and spinal cord damage.
Studies show that lower doses of Lyrica cause fewer side effects and still relieve pain just as well as higher doses.
Also used in combination with other medications to treat epilepsy (partial seizures).

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica is only approved for use in adults. It can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report new or worsening depression or unusual changes in mood or behavior to your doctor right away, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica is only approved for use in adults. It can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime when taking Lyrica. Get medical help immediately if you develop any head/neck swelling or abdominal pain that does not go away.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that can angioedema

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime when taking Lyrica. Get medical help immediately if you develop any head/neck swelling or abdominal pain that does not go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

risks_warnings.title: Foot and leg swelling
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. If Lyrica does cause swelling, it should improve when you stop taking the medication, but if it doesn't do away, talk to your about other medication choices.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea.  Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It is safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea. risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant because it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about other medication you can take. The same warning applies to men taking Lyrica and possible risk to an unborn baby.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

upsides: Low doses work well to treat certain kinds of chronic pain. It can take 2 weeks to feel the full effects of the medication.
Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Taking Cyclobenzaprine along with other medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity) and nausea, vomiting and diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Cyclobenzaprine.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Gabapentin suddenly can increase the number of seizures. Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It's safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Paxil is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin activity in the brain, which regulates mood.
basics.bottom_line: Paxil is good for treating depression and anxiety but it causes more weight gain, sleepiness, and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause more sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate than most antidepressants.
More likely to cause minor weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) or make you feel sick if you miss a dose than other antidepressants.
Can harm an unborn child, so you can't take it if you're pregnant.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people younger than age 24.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take with food to avoid upset stomach.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Paxil may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Paxil is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Paxil with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Paxil suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Paxil can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Paxil can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

description_processed.orig: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Paxil can harm a developing fetus. Don't use it while pregnant, especially in the first trimester. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

drugs.name: Prozac

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take in the morning with food to avoid side effects.
Takes about 8 to 12 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your mood.
Stop taking it slowly to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Prozac may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Prozac is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Prozac may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Prozac is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Prozac with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms. Also, Prozac takes a long time to completely clear from your body. Make sure enough time is allowed to clear the medication completely before switching to another medication that affects serotonin, especially an MAO-I antidepressant.
risk_factors: Using other medications that affect serotonin

Also, Prozac takes a long time to completely clear from your body. Make sure enough time is allowed to clear the medication completely before switching to another medication that affects serotonin, especially an MAO-I antidepressant.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Prozac suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Prozac can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. If you have any risk factors, the maximum dose for you may be lower. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

description_processed.orig: Prozac can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Prozac can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Prozac can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.
